subject: Art
title: Selection Tools
description: Lasso, marquee, and magic wand ‚Äî isolating areas for editing.

hook.text: Want to move just the character's arm? Change only the sky color? Apply an effect to just the background? Selection tools let you isolate any part of your canvas for targeted editing.

buildup.text: Key selection tools: rectangular/elliptical marquee (geometric selections), lasso (freehand selection), polygonal lasso (straight-edged selection), and magic wand (selects by color similarity).

discovery.text: Selections can be added to (hold Shift), subtracted from (hold Alt), or inverted (select everything EXCEPT what you selected). You can also feather selections for soft edges instead of hard cutoffs.

twist.text: The most powerful selection tool? Painting on a layer mask. Instead of trying to click-select complex edges, you paint the selection with a brush ‚Äî full control, soft and hard edges, easily editable.

climax.text: Use the lasso tool to select a section of your painting, then try: moving it, transforming it, changing its color, or applying a filter to just that area. Selections are the key to precise editing.

punchline.text: Selections let you edit parts of your art without touching the rest. Precision meets flexibility.

quiz.question: What does 'feathering' a selection do?
options: Creates a soft, gradual edge instead of a hard cutoff
